resources.string: Talk to {destinationName}
Go To {POITags}
XXXXX
The sorceress<g id="female_explainS" /> spent a few weeks studying the Blight in Weaver's Fen, and now she's<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> certain it can be used as a weapon against the Corrupted.
I<g id="female_impatient" /> have spent decades among the Angry Earth, and I'm skeptical of her reasoning.
The Untamed Garden

After a successful offensive in Great Cleave, the focus now turns to a more permanent solution for Corruption.\nTravel into Edengrove with Sun and Morgaine to search for knowledge, weapons, or allies that may help in the battle ahead.
"Why are you skeptical?"
The Blight has only surfaced in recent years on Aeternum, while<g id="female_thosepeasants" /> clashes between the Angry Earth and Corruption have occurred for centuries.
Most<g id="female_disagreeCrossarms" /> don't even realize that the Stormwall is an expression of the Angry Earth.
"Is the Stormwall Corrupted?"
Everyone<g id="female_lookRight" /> thinks that, but the visible Corruption simply<g id="female_smackfist" /> strains against the barrier the Angry Earth manifested to keep it contained.
But what matters now<g id="female_youknow" /> is that Morgaine, and all of us, proceed with caution.
"Where is Morgaine now?"
She rushes<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> ahead on the road to Edengrove, the heart of the Angry Earth's presence on Aeternum.
Please,<g id="male_agree1" /> catch her and get her to at least hear me out. I'll<g id="female_sighRelief" /> gather my things, and then join you on the road.
UNUSED - WALKAWAY
So<g id="female_thinking" /> different from the Fenâ€¦ everything here is so alive. Equally deadly, but in a different sort of way.

<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />At last! How<g id="female_sighBigRelief" /> I have looked forward to finding you, Soulwarden!<g id="male_nodMild" /> I confirmed the Blight we saw in Weaver's Fen can resist Corruption!
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />But your allies at Caer Dun<g id="male_whocares" /> - especially that leaf-lover Sun Fuchun - refused to hear me out!
"She says to proceed carefully."
Bah!<g id="male_dismissGetLost2" /> In crises, caution can be foolish, but I'm willing to humor her.<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> I trust she'll be joining us? Fine.
Before we proceed, however, I've<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" /> discovered there are suspicious activities in this region, enemies of a different sort.
"What type of enemies?"
Varangians,<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" /> ruthless raiders who seek to amass all the island's magical artifacts. They often search Myrddin's old haunts.
If you'll investigate their camp to<g id="male_gestureAhead" /> the south, I'll wait and smooth out Sun's ruffled feathers.
We need to know why the Varangians have come to Edengrove.<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> Go on.

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part one

The truth of the origins of the Angry Earth eludes me, but evidence indicates they only appeared some time after the Ancients disappeared. Curious.

Perhaps more importantly, their bonds to the natural world, the true natural world, are complex, and if my theory is correct, there may be some fundamental aspect of the Angry Earth that is related to the insidious influence of Corruption. There is much for me to learn here...
Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part one.
The truth of the origins of the Angry Earth eludes me, but evidence indicates they only appeared some time after the Ancients disappeared. Curious.
Perhaps more importantly, their bonds to the natural world, the true natural world, are complex, and if my theory is correctâ€¦
there may be some fundamental aspect of the Angry Earth that is related to the insidious influence of Corruption. There is much for me to learn hereâ€¦
Heh!<g id="female_laughMed" /> You'll be glad to know Sun and I have settled our differences, and although my studies will be...<g id="female_gestureRightM" /> slowed somewhat, they will continue.
But you've returned from<g id="female_leftfistThreaten" /> the Varangians' camp! Tell me, what did you find?
"Myrddin's research on Edengrove."
So my brother<g id="female_crossarms" /> was here! I knew he ranged this far north, but I did not know he studied the Angry Earth!<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> This is quite a revelation!
I must<g id="female_takeitem" /> take these notes where I can study them more carefullyâ€¦ you should talk to Sun.
I think we're now<g id="female_spreadarms" /> agreed on continuing Morgaine's research, but with caution.<g id="male_nodMild" /> I hope this new collaborative spirit is here to stay.
"She's gone on ahead again."
Well,<g id="female_swayBored" /> it seems you've found something to capture Morgaine's attention.
That's good<g id="female_youknowS" /> because I should like to share with you more about this wondrous place we venture into.<g id="female_beckon" /> Please, follow meâ€¦

string.comment: All Sun IGC lines for VOX.
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: AlchemistSun

resources.string: Behold, Edengrove; the jewel of Aeternum! Here is a land where nature still commands. Itâ€™s thorny, poisonous, and beautiful. Youâ€™ll never find in all the world such an abundance of peculiar flora. Speaking of peculiar, did you know the life cycle of the Angry Earth begins in Edengrove? Iâ€™ve been studying them for ages, but always from a distance. Now, I'm finally to the heart of the matter. They're key to defeating the Corrupted, I'm sure of it. There's a druid settlement nearby. They brokered a shaky truce with the Angry Earth in order to maintain a colony here. No small feat, that. The druids will point us to the answers we seek.
Behold, Edengrove.
The jewel of Aeternum!
Here is a land where nature still commands.
Itâ€™s thorny,
poisonous,
and beautiful!
Youâ€™ll never find in all the world such an abundance of peculiar flora.
Speaking of peculiar,
Did you know the life cycle of the Angry Earth begins in Edengrove?
Iâ€™ve been studying them for ages, but always from a distance.
Now, I'm finally to the heart of the matter.
They're key to defeating the Corrupted, I'm sure of it.
There's a druid settlement nearby.
They brokered a shaky truce with the Angry Earth in order to maintain a colony here.
No small feat, that.
The druids will point us to the answers we seek.
There are countless<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" /> Ancient Ruins in Edengrove, most of them constructed before the Angry Earth came.
<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />But the terraces on these roads were built later, possibly<g id="female_explainS" /> even by humans who worshipped the Angry Earth.
"We could find useful clues here."
<g id="male_nodMild" />Yes, that is likely; there may even be<g id="female_lookLeft" /> glyphs in the stonework that will give us hints to the Angry Earth's origins.
Let us search, and if you find anything,<g id="female_headnodding" /> give a shout, and I will attempt to translate.
Everything I've learned on Aeternum<g id="female_youknow" /> now needs to be reconsidered in this new light.
If these glyphs are truthful, the Angry<g id="male_dazed" /> Earth literally grew from the bones of dead Ancientsâ€¦ I confess I'm somewhat in shock.
"We need to tell Morgaine."
<g id="male_nodMild" />Yes, yes, we must. I caught a glimpse of an encampment<g id="female_pointLeft" /> down the road by the water. Perhaps Morgaine is there.
<g id="female_youknowS" />We should head there directly,<g id="female_nodConsider" /> if for no other reason than to have a safe place to consider what we've learned.
I would<g id="female_nodConsider" /> like to continue on to the druidic enclave as soon as we get our bearings.
Meet Morgaine at the western border of Edengrove
Investigate the nearby Varangian encampment
Eliminate the {targetName}s in the camp
Search the Varangian camp for a purpose to their presence
Follow Sun down the path into Edengrove
Listen to the history of Edengrove
Speak with Sun further down the path into Edengrove
Enter {POITags} and search for the murals
Investigate the first mural
Two Ancients, on opposite sides of a conflict.
Investigate the second mural
Angry Earth warriors and... Corrupted? A green barrier divides them.
Investigate the third mural
Three towers, surrounded by trees and floating rocks. Edengrove?
Order the murals using the nearby devices
Follow the path of the beacons
Investigate the final mural
Rendezvous with Morgaine and Sun in {POITags}
Locate Morgaine and Sun in {POITags}
I shared our new insights<g id="female_gestureRightS" /> with Morgaine, and of course,<g id="female_gestureRightM" /> she immediately insisted this is proof of her theory about the Blight.
But we must<g id="female_youknowS" /> consider the facts as they are, without any preconceived notions.
"The Blight is still a mystery."
Exactly,<g id="female_nodding" /> and that is what I will be working on.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> It seems the sorceress has become distracted with clues about her brother.
Help Morgaine with her search and then<g id="male_convince02" /> meet me in Caliburne, the elder druids' enclave to the north.
I have a strange<g id="female_lookaroundWonder" /> feeling about this place, Soulwarden. It's as if Myrddin placed secrets here he intended for me to discover.

Good work<g id="male_complimentplayer" /> in the ruins up there. If the Angry Earth were spawned after the first war with Corruption,<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> they may well hold the secret to defeating it.
I wonder if that's why Myrddin<g id="female_lookLeft" /> came to this region.
On the Wizard's Trail
Having reached the safety of the traveler's camp, Sun resolves to learn what she can before traveling to the settlement.\nAccompany Morgaine to the north in search of evidence of Myrddin's fate.
"But Myrddin fell to Corruption."
Eventually,<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> yes, but he spent many years before that seeking answers about how he might study it,<g id="female_explainS" /> without falling under its influence.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />My brother kept many secrets, and I<g id="female_youknowS" /> believe some of them are hidden here in Edengrove.
"We should retrace his steps."

Yes,<g id="male_nodunderstand" /> my bond with my brother was strong, especially being scarred in our final encounter, and I can almost sense<g id="female_lookup" /> his presenceâ€¦ hovering above us?
Come,<g id="female_beckon" /> let us ascend to greater heights to... get a better view.
UNUSED - WALKAWAY
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />Sometimes secrets are standing right in front of us, and we are oblivious nonetheless. Do<g id="female_gestureLeft" /> you see this stone creag suspended in roots?
What does this tell us?<g id="female_youknow" /> The earth gropes after the energy in this stoneâ€¦
"Azoth? The blood of dead Ancients?"
Oh my,<g id="female_thinking" /> that is... a rather outlandish proposition, but based on your earlier discovery, it makes sense. Myrddin must've known this.
Look for samples<g id="male_quidproquo" /> of the veined stone that might be mined. Whatever's inside, we need it.
This. This<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" /> was constructed by Myrddin! I can almost smell the redolence of herbs he carried in his robes!<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> It is uncanny!
It's like he wanted me<g id="female_smackfist" /> to find this device - it must serve some purpose!
"We should activate it."
What do you think<g id="male_darnit" /> I've been doing here? Just humming a melody? The<g id="male_gestureLeft" /> blasted thing is lacking an energy source.
Just the kind of absurdity my brother so enjoyedâ€¦<g id="male_rememberBig" /> wait, try using the crystals from the veined stones!
Go on<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> then, deposit the crystals, activate Myrddin's infernal machine!
Ah, there we are! Ahemâ€¦ if you can hear me, come north-northwest, follow the path through the crumbling wall, and into the cave of color. I've left something for you.
Thatâ€¦ that was Myrddin! Quickly, let us follow his instruction!
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I can't believe my ears! I heard Myrddin's voice... like he was right<g id="female_gestureForward02" /> beside me! You heard it too!
<g id="female_youknowS" />This is the place! A cavern of crystals, emanating a power<g id="male_lookrightSurprised" /> unlike any I've seen, even here on Aeternum.
"We should go in and investigate."
<g id="male_nodMild" />Yes, we must! But those damned<g id="female_pointThreaten" /> Varangian raiders are already rummaging aboutâ€¦ who knows how much they've already spoiled?!
Destroy them,<g id="female_waverightNoway" /> and carve a path for us to reach Myrddin's sanctum. We're so close now!
Lost for centuries, no<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> clue to your whereaboutsâ€¦ and now, a path to follow. I shall find you, brother.
When time and space are suspendedâ€¦ words from past to future hold the key.
Words are but vessels. Prisons of meaning, where an idea, or a mind can be trapped.
Like the facets of these crystals, mind, heart and soul are just aspects of a singular thing. Take heed, sister.
Like the facets of these crystals, mind, heart and soul are just aspects of a singular thing.
Take heed, sister.
Travel the road through {POITags} to get a better view
Search the Ancient Road for signs of Myrddin
Collect {itemName}s from the base of the creag
Continue searching for signs of Myrddin and acquire more Creag Crystals
Find Morgaine and deliver the gathered crystals
Use the collected crystals on the overgrown sphere
Listen to Myrddin's words
Follow Myrddin's instructions and catch up with Morgaine
Enter the {POITags} and clear the Varangian threat within
Carve a path through the {targetName}s to reach Myrddin's sanctum
Search for any remnants of Myrddin's work within the sanctum
Investigate the remains of Myrddin's workshop
Study the glyphs on the wall
Inspect the pendant
Flip through the discarded book
There... his voice<g id="female_lookaroundWonder" /> again, speaking as if he knew I'd come, and left some riddleâ€¦ how? What games do you play, brother?
Tell me<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> Soulwarden, what did you find in the sanctum that elicited this response?
"Some scrawled notes and a pendant."

A pendant?<g id="female_explainS" /> Myrddin never cared for jewelry... wait, this wasâ€¦ it<g id="male_pointAngry" /> was mine! That bastard of a brother must've stolen it from me.<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> I spent weeks searching!
Bah! Can't<g id="female_shakeheadNo" /> get distracted, there's more to learn here, I know it!
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />For years, I've looked for clues to Myrddin's fate, and only<g id="female_shocked" /> now do I discover this sanctum? I feel like a fool for not coming here sooner!
There must be some clue in his wordsâ€¦<g id="female_gestureForward01" /> something about his research into sundering.
The Hope of New Growth
While Morgaine remains in the Crystal Cave, Sun takes the opportunity to further explore the mysteries of the Angry Earth.\nAccompany Sun on her exploration of the crater.
"What kind of sundering?"
Myrddin<g id="female_impatient" /> was obsessed with the Ancients' methods of sundering the souls of their guardians.
He hoped it could allow him to study<g id="female_shakeheadNo" /> Corruption, protecting his soul from falling under its influence.
"Like a Soulwarden's Heartgem."
Similar, but the Soulwardens<g id="male_quidproquo" /> only emerged after Myrddin became the Crimson Sorcererâ€¦ he knew them only as enemies.
Hmm.<g id="female_lookRight" /> This is going to take time, young one. I must study every detail of this chamber.
"I should go meet Sun Fuchun."
<g id="male_nodMild" />Ah, yes!<g id="male_lookupSmall" /> Tell her what we found. Although she'll want to see this, andâ€¦<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> no, that's not good. Not yet.
I need<g id="male_scoldFingerwag" /> time, Soulwarden. You and Sun can get on with studying the Angry Earth. I'll join you in Caliburne soon.
Meet with Sun and let<g id="female_crossarms" /> her know what we have found. Her focus is on the Angry Earth, but mine is on my brother, as it should be.
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />The elder druids who founded this settlement are mostly goneâ€¦ along<g id="female_shrugShort" /> with whatever secrets they knew about the Angry Earth.
Not many records of<g id="male_secretive" /> the elder druids here, but I did find clues as to how they kept peace with the Angry Earth.
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />But what about you? I know<g id="male_shrugBrief" /> Morgaine felt strongly that her brother came hereâ€¦ did you find any signs of him?
"We found Myrddin's sanctum nearby."
That explains her absence,<g id="female_nodConsider" /> and it's welcome news! We can delve deeper into the Angry Earth's relationship to Corruption.
I'm curious about<g id="male_lookupSmall" /> these druidic rituals used to commune with what<g id="female_explainS" /> they called "the forest spirit."
"Can we perform these rituals?"
<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />Great idea! The elder<g id="female_nodConsider" /> druids brought offerings to shrines in the woods to make contact.
We will need to extract<g id="female_swayBored" /> samples from dryads or other Angry Earth. Let's collect as many as we can and meet in the mangroves. Good luck.
It's amazing.<g id="female_lookaroundWonder" /> This mangrove swamp is teeming with the life force of the Angry Earth!
<g id="male_nodMild" />They are stronger here, more resilient, and quicker to resurrect. Their<g id="female_gestureDown" /> power is bound to the land here.
"What does that mean?"
A plant's hardiness is<g id="female_explainS" /> determined by the dirt encasing its roots, and so do these dryads and other life forms thrive here.
<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />But let us proceed. Search for these<g id="female_gestureForward02" /> "shrines" and offer up the samplesâ€¦ then let's see what happens.

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I am skeptical that the elder druids really communed with any<g id="female_nodshrugokay" /> 'forest spirits,' more likely they were a little addled. We will see soon enough.

The forests of Edengrove are not places, they are entities in and of themselves, each speaking for its own, but with a shared voice.

Here, the lives of our walking brethren begin in the Garden, but like us, we draw our strength from a deeper well.

All the children are fed by the mother, their sustenance drawn from the river flowing from the one true source.
If a limb becomes infected, it must be severed to protect the source.
The forests of Edengrove are not places, they are entities in and of themselves,
each speaking for its own, but with a shared voice.
Here, the lives of our walking brethren begin in the Garden,
but like us, we draw our strength from a deeper well.
All the children are fed by the mother,
their sustenance drawn from the river flowing from the one true source.
If a limb becomes infected, it must be severed to protect the source.
Well, either my sanity is finally slipping, or<g id="female_shocked" /> the ritual worked! I heard a voice, speakingâ€¦<g id="female_explainS" /> something about a garden and severing infected limbs.
I wonder<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> if that's a reference to the Blight in the nearby ruins.
"How can we learn more?"
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I don't know. Perhaps we collect samples<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" /> from the creatures who've become Blighted? Yes, yes, and then seek out another shrine.
It's worth a try at least. I wonder if there are shrines even in<g id="female_pointLeft" /> the midst of this? Let's find out.

Alone but alive, sustenance is needed, but never satiated.

A thirst acquired like a contagion from our enemies, but of the Earth, and now within.

The needs felt are beyond those fitting for life; there is a desire to... spread.

Come closer, others, feel the warmth of our evolved form, a new entity, immune to the enemy, but forever alone... cut off from the well.
Alone but alive, sustenance is needed, but never satiated.
A thirst acquired like a contagion from our enemies, but of the Earth, and now within.
The needs felt are beyond those fitting for life; there is a desire to... spread.
Come closer, others, feel the warmth of our evolved form,
a new entity, immune to the enemy, but forever alone... cut off from the well.
One step, one fragment of<g id="male_explain" /> knowledge, leads to another. Growth comes in fits and starts, and so does our comprehension of these elemental creatures.
There! I heard it too, but different<g id="male_dontknow" /> than before, weaker, alone and very confused.
It would seem<g id="male_agree1" /> the Blighted Angry Earth are cut off from the power that sustains them. That<g id="female_youknowS" /> is the power we need to fight Corruption.
"Let's look for this well of power."
Yes, perhaps<g id="female_spreadarms" /> here in this eastern grove, where the Blight has not encroached and the forest remains pure.
Let's collect more healthy samples and search<g id="female_headnodding" /> for another of those shrines we might commune with.
If the Blighted Angry Earth are cut off from their source<g id="female_lookConcern" /> of power, I fear there is no method of using the Blight to battle Corruption.

A melody emerges from the sounds of the natural world, a song of celebration.. and of lamentation.

The brilliance of new life blooming in the grove, and the dirge sung in memory of those whose sacrifice gave us our purpose.

Rivers within rivers provide the light of our vengeance, our fury, our power.
The childen of the Angry Earth are charges of the Motherwell, the source of our enemies' doom.
A melody emerges from the sounds of the natural world, a song of celebration... and of lamentation.
The brilliance of new life blooming in the grove,
and the dirge sung in memory of those whose sacrifice gave us our purpose.
Rivers within rivers provide the light of our vengeance, our fury, our power.
The children of the Angry Earth are charges of the Motherwell, the source of our enemies' doom.
Travel to {POITags} to meet with Sun Fuchun
Locate Sun in Caliburne
Travel into {POITags} to gather cuttings from the Angry Earth
Gather {itemName} from the patrolling {targetName}
Locate the communing pool used by the Druids
Place the cuttings into the pool
Listen to the voice of Adiana
Continue to gather cuttings from the Angry Earth in {POITags}
Gather {itemName} from {targetName}
Climb the ruins to reach the communing pool
Search the ruins south of {POITags} for another communal pool
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />Now, I think we've finally found something useful. The whispers<g id="female_thinking" /> spoke of the source, from where the Angry Earth's lifeforce is drawn.
If there is power to fight the Corruption,<g id="female_youknow" /> it is guarded within this Motherwell.
"What is the Motherwell?"
I'm not<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> sure, but the scrolls in Caliburne spoke of something similar, a hidden basin sacred to the Angry Earth.
The waters<g id="female_leanpointConvince" /> of this region are collected there, and if this is true, that might be the key to finding it.
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />The energy that sustains the Angry Earth flows through the waters here...<g id="female_nodYes" /> what could be more natural?
We find the Motherwell where all the waters of Edengrove<g id="female_explainS" /> flow, and we find a source of immense power.
Dowsing for Answers
Communing with the mind of the Angry Earth revealed a new facet of the strange creatures.\nHelp Sun locate the sacred Angry Earth location called the Motherwell.
"So we follow the river's flow?"
Ah, wait,<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" /> but this is clearly not just the waters of this region, but rather the Azoth that is undoubtedly bound to it.
We need some device<g id="male_quidproquo" /> with which we read the flow of Azoth to triangulate the position of the Motherwell.
"My Azoth staff might help."
Of course! Brilliant!<g id="female_chuckle" /> It's almost as if fate has guided us here, equipped for this very purpose.
Let us search<g id="female_spreadarms" /> the groves for places where Azoth has collected, and then use your staff to trace the flow of power.
To think this could all be as simple<g id="female_taptemple" /> as tracking the flow of Azoth. Let us hope!
Now I want an Azoth staff of my own.<g id="female_laughMed" /> I might have to reconsider your invitation to become a Soulwarden.
This looks promising! An upsurge<g id="female_gestureForward01" /> from deep underground, certainly a pocket of Azoth, seeking to find its way to the source.
I suspect this what<g id="female_youknowS" /> the whispers meant by rivers within rivers.
"What should I do?"
Place your Azoth Staff<g id="male_handsHipsConsider" /> in the water and step back. If this works, the staff should move in some way and point us in the general direction of the Motherwell.
That's<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" /> my theory, at least.
Well, it gave us a direction to travel in, at least! I suppose this could be<g id="female_smackfist" /> a wild turkey chase, but what if it isn't?
So far the staff has pointed south<g id="female_thinking" /> each time, but there is a lot of ground in that direction. Perhaps we need to find the location where all these lines intersect.

<g id="male_nodMild" />There's something to this. If I'm not mistaken,<g id="female_explainS" /> this is all pointing towards the mountains to the south.<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> Though the exact location we still need to figure out.
Well, that was<g id="male_handheart" /> an adventure! We trekked across half of Edengrove. Let's just hope this helps to pinpoint the location of the Motherwell.
<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />I took note of each direction your staff indicated.<g id="female_headnodding" /> Now I just need time with a map.
"Then what?"
Then we follow the<g id="male_gestureAhead" /> flow of Azoth, and find out for ourselves if this Motherwell still exists.
We should inform<g id="female_leanforwardListenNod" /> Morgaine of what we've learned, if you'll find her, I'll figure out all the mapping parts.
My mind is spinning<g id="female_lookaroundConfused" /> from what we discovered in the crystal sanctum. I believe Myrddin left something for us, something that could prove very valuable.
Explore {POITags} and find a dowsing site
Place the Azoth Staff at the dowsing site
Seek out another dowsing site in {POITags}
Find the dowsing site in {POITags}
Gather {itemName} from {targetName}
Find a third dowsing site at {POITags}
Gather {itemName} from {targetName}
Find the dowsing site in {POITags}
Escort Sun out of the Blighted area
Distract the Blighted and give cover for Sun's escape
Rendezvous with Sun at {POITags}
Meet Morgaine in {POITags} and share what you've learned
<g id="male_nodMild" />Ah, Soulwarden, I've been waiting for your return! There<g id="male_smallSingleWave" /> is an incredible power hidden within the Ancient Towers here.
Almost everything<g id="female_leanforwardListensound" /> in Myrddin's sanctum suggests he found something thereâ€¦ or left it for us to find.
"Sun and I have found something."
<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />This is about the Angry Earth, yes? Make no mistake - I am interested,<g id="male_waghand01" /> but it will have to wait.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Myrddin's clues strongly assert time<g id="female_youknow" /> is critical in solving his riddles, and the answers<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> are hidden in these towers.
If my reasoning is accurate, and it usually is, I<g id="female_explainS" /> believe Myrddin may have unlocked the secret to the ritual of sundering.
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />If this is true, and we can find whatever further<g id="male_agree1" /> secrets he left for us, this could change everything.
The Wizard's Trial

Morgaine believes that Myrddin has hidden vital secrets away somewhere within Edengrove - and has a hunch that the towers around the crater may hold the key to finding them.\nTravel with her to the towers and investigate her theory.
"This could help fight Corruption?"
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />Precisely! My brother - fiendish<g id="male_explain" /> bastard that he could be - was also a scholar of unrivaled insight.

<g id="male_headShakeNo" />He spent DECADES studying Corruption,<g id="female_explainS" /> and he hid his greatest discovery<g id="male_gestureHereweare" /> hereâ€¦ undoubtedly obscured by magical veils.
"We need to pierce these veils."
<g id="male_nodMild" />Yes, Myrddin<g id="female_impatient" /> was quite fond of such tricks, like hiding my personal affects when I turned my back.
<g id="male_convince02" />Unveiling what he's hidden requires solving his riddles. Heh, Artorius<g id="male_goodnews" /> and I would spend days wracking our minds.
"What riddles do we need to solve?"
A combination<g id="male_quidproquo" /> of the clues from the sanctum, and whatever's in these towers.
You'll be surprised to hear I've even<g id="female_suppresslaugh" /> invited Galahad in case his memories can help.<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> Speak with him, and then we'll visit these towers.
Myrddin definitely<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> hinted that time was a critical component here, so let's not waste it.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />It was with great hesitation that I departed<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> from Caer Dun during a time of such critical preparation.
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />I can only hope Morgaine's theories lead us to something of<g id="male_shrugBrief" /> tremendous value to assist in our efforts.
<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />Greetings, Soulwarden. You seem as<g id="male_nodSympathySmall" /> surprised as I am to find me here. Morgaine promises we are close to learning Myrddin's secrets.
If any light can be shed on the fate<g id="male_lookupSmall" /> of the High King, I am willing to take the chance.
"It will help fight Corruption."
That would<g id="female_nodshrugokay" /> be a worthy outcome as well, but you should know the damned wizard's riddles are notoriously difficult.
All the same, let us venture<g id="male_pointsoutthere" /> into these towers and learn whatever we can. Lead on, Soulwarden.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Morgaine seems insistent on inspecting those towers,<g id="male_explain" /> thinks there's some kind of magic in them holding her brother.
Gods, why<g id="male_noway" /> is it always magic? Why not a sword, or a lever, or a simple secret doorâ€¦

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part two\nI've discovered the gardens of genesis, a sacred grove here where the Angry Earth seem to be spawned in great number. Perhaps like us, resurrected from some other place? Fascinating.\nThis is not the only sacred location here, however. The dryads guard these massive towers with furious intent. Many secrets must lie hidden within. I must find a way in.
Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part two.
I've discovered the Gardens of Genesis, a sacred grove here where the Angry Earth seem to be spawned in great number.
Perhaps like us, resurrected from some other place? Fascinating. This is not the only sacred location here, however.
The dryads guard these massive towers with furious intent. Many secrets must lie hidden within. I must find a way in.

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part three
I passed through the Towers surreptitiously and found the knowledge I have long sought, the process of sundering one's soul.
If I'm correct, I may have unlocked the ability to hide away a portion of my soul so that I might risk exposure to Corruption. 
If I'm wrong, then I suppose this is both a letter of goodbye and one of apology for what might ensue. I hope I am not wrong.
Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part three.
I passed through the Towers surreptitiously and found the knowledge I have long sought, the process of sundering one's soul.
If I'm correct, I may have unlocked the ability to hide away a portion of my soul so that I might risk exposure to Corruption.
If I'm wrong, then I suppose this is both a letter of goodbye and one of apology for what might ensue. I hope I am not wrong.

Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part four
I leave this final note for my liege and my sister, the only two with whom I would entrust the sanctity of my soul.
I have hidden here a bastion of my own undoing, a stronghold against time and space, a place where I leave a part of myself for safekeeping.
My soul is dear to my heart, and thus, the keys to veil are those things closest to the hearts of those I love. 
I now step into possibilities of futures I cannot foresee; many of them dark, and though I consign myself to whatever fate my choices lead to, I do this that the small knowledge and insight I have gained can still be reclaimed if the need is dire.
Myrddin's Research Notes on Edengrove, part four.
I leave this final note for my liege and my sister, the only two with whom I would entrust the sanctity of my soul.
I have hidden here a bastion of my own undoing, a stronghold against time and space, a place where I leave a part of myself for safekeeping.
My soul is dear to my heart, and thus, the keys to veil are those things closest to the hearts of those I love.
I now step into possibilities of futures I cannot foresee; many of them dark, and though I consign myself to whatever fate my choices lead toâ€¦
I do this that the small knowledge and insight I have gained can still be reclaimed if the need is dire.

I'm no enchanter, but<g id="male_gestureRight" /> these designs do remind me of the gewgaws I saw in Myrddin's workshop centuries ago.<g id="female_explainS" /> Perhaps there's some truth to Morgaine's theory.
This isâ€¦ quite unsettling. The<g id="male_pointRight" /> shield of my lord king in such a state, is this meant to disturb me?<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> Or is this Myrddin's riddle?
I'm sorry,<g id="male_shakehead" /> Soulwarden. I'm afraid I'm at a loss.
"It's close to those Myrddin lovedâ€¦"

You meanâ€¦ yes,<g id="male_pointRealize" /> of course! Artorius's shield was indeed held over his heart! Let us try this and<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> find if it might be the solution to Myrddin's puzzle.
Well done, my liege! I hope your shield has protected you as well it has allowed for my protection in this instance. I will see you soon.
Well done, my liege!
I hope your shield has protected you as well it has allowed for my protection in this instance.
I will see you soon.
So that didâ€¦ something?<g id="male_lookaroundSmall" /> Can never be too certain about how magic works, or doesn't. But it seems we did whatever was expected.
We should go<g id="male_nod2" /> find out if Morgaine has had any luck in the other tower.

<g id="female_smackfist" />I knew it! These glyphs<g id="female_gestureAroundRoom" /> are the same as my brother left behind in his workshop. This has to be his handiwork. We are close, I can feel it.
<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />Did you read the notes, Soulwarden? My brotherâ€¦<g id="male_guiltyLookdown" /> I do not think he has hidden some item away or some small scrap of knowledge.
Could it be<g id="female_youknowS" /> that some part of him still lives?
"I hope we'll soon find out. "

<g id="male_nodMild" />Yes, let us solve this riddle, whatever it may bring. This<g id="female_lookaroundShifty" /> looks similar to the Ancient prison device in the Fen, but Myrddin must've changed it.
It would seem to require<g id="male_nodMild" /> the insertion of some item, something small.
"It's close to those Myrddin lovedâ€¦"
Of course!<g id="female_rightfistThreaten" /> That's exactly the kind of riddle my brother so enjoyedâ€¦. It's the pendant.<g id="female_explainS" /> That's why he took it!
Quickly,<g id="female_giveitem" /> here, take the pendant and let's see if it works!
Well, sister, now you know why I stole your pendant. Let us hope that was for the cause of seeing us soon reunited.
Well, sister, now you know why I stole your pendant.
Let us hope that was for the cause of seeing us soon reunited.
There was definitely a change in the energies here,<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> but to what end, I know not.
Come,<g id="female_beckon" /> we must look to the other towers, this cannot be the only piece of the puzzle.
Two keys to unlock this place. Could my brother truly have foreseen this? It is fortunate Galahad was here to act the part of Artorius.
Follow Morgaine's hunch and travel to {POITags}
Search the tower for signs of Myrddin's presence
Touch the sphere
Cut a path through the {targetName} in the tower
Continue to the upper levels of the tower
Insert Morgaine's key into the Ancient console
Travel to {POITags} and search for more devices
Find an item related to Artorius
Use Galahad's key to activate the nearby devices
Inspect the Ancient device
Mount Artorius's Shield on the wall
Retrieve the Key from the hidden niche
Use Galahad's Key on the Ancient device above
I can't<g id="male_lookUpAround" /> believe it! That was not there a moment ago!<g id="male_convince02" /> That wizard floated a tower into the sky, then made it invisible!
God's teeth! Such powers<g id="male_gestureUp" /> should not be possible. I don't even know what to say.
I suppose, however, that<g id="male_nodunderstand" /> the floating tower is revealed, and it beckons to us.
This could very well be a trap<g id="male_ragepoundfist" /> though! Who knows what to expect from the likes of Myrddin's magic?
Myrddin's Fate

Unlocking the strange devices in the towers of Edengrove revealed a tower floating above the crater, which Morgaine believes to be Myrddin's prison.\nInvestigate this strange area with Morgaine and Galahad.
"You don't have to come."
Every instinct screams that I should stay, but what<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> kind of knight would balk at danger when so much is at stake?
If Myrddin is in there, I have questions, and<g id="male_gestureDownRight" /> he will answer or feel the sting of my blade!
"Alrightâ€¦ let's hear him out."
Very well, Soulwarden.<g id="male_nodMild" /> I'll follow your lead. If it is the wizard<g id="male_dontknow" /> himself, I have never relished conversing with the man.
But<g id="male_handheart" /> I must know what became of my lord king.
UNUSED - WALKAWAY
I have seen this towerâ€¦ was<g id="female_lookup" /> it in a dream? Or are we dreaming even now?
Amazing! Yes, I recognize<g id="female_spreadarms" /> this tower from Myrddin's drawings and diagrams. He always aspired to build such a structure.
How strange it is to think it has been hidden here all along,<g id="female_lookRight" /> and he may even be inside.
"Are you ready to see it through?"
Honestly, I don't know.<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> I have so many questions to ask, and the knowledge he has could turn the tide in the battle against Corruption.
We<g id="g_male_shakehead" /> stand at the precipice of too many possibilities to consider.<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> Let us go forward.
I have stood on mountaintops and cliffs, looked out<g id="male_lookDown" /> over the land and sea... but this is far too unnatural for my taste.
I know I must be here,<g id="male_crossarmsNo" /> but I will be happier when my feet are planted firmly on the ground.

string.comment: All Galahad IGC lines for VOX.
string.speaker: Ser Galahad
string.name: KnightGalahad

resources.string: Enough sibling sentimentality! Dammit Myrddin, where is Artorius? What have you done with him? Beg pardonâ€¦ but the fate of the world takes precedent over a sibling reunion! The king isâ€¦ within?

string.comment: All Morgaine IGC lines for VOX.
string.speaker: Morgaine
string.name: SorceressMorgaine

resources.string: It is me, though I am older, yet you've grown younger instead? And free of the Crimson Sorcerer? Haâ€¦ Oh, you tin-plated fool! Can't you put aside your obsessions for even a moment? The king's fate is long past, what matters now is the present.

string.comment: All Myrddin IGC lines for VOX.
string.speaker: Myrddin
string.name: WizardMyrddin

resources.string: Where am I? Is this real? Morgaineâ€¦ is that you? Iâ€¦ Iâ€¦ Cease this foolish bickering, both of you! Within this prison, time and space blur. I see glimpses of the king. At times, he seems real... Indeed, in truth, my purpose here is to deliver a message to you, Soulwarden.
Where am I? Is this real?
Morgaineâ€¦ is that you?
It is me, though I am olderâ€¦
Yet you've grown younger instead?
And free of the Crimson Sorcerer? Haâ€¦
Enough sibling sentimentality!
Dammit Myrddin, where is Artorius?
What have you done with him?
Iâ€¦ Iâ€¦
Oh, you tin-plated fool! Can't you put aside your obsession for even a moment?
Beg pardonâ€¦ but the fate of the world takes precedence over a sibling reunion!
Cease this foolish bickering, both of you!
Within this prison, time and space blur.
I see glimpses of the king. At times, he seems real...
The king isâ€¦ within?
The king's fate is long past, what matters now is the present.
Indeed, in truthâ€¦
My purpose here is to deliver a message to you, Soulwarden.
xxxxxx
My time is limited, so I'll be brief. Imprisoning<g id="male_explain" /> myself here was the only way I could end the war and save my sister.
But the Tempest is now<g id="male_lookRight" /> poised to finish what I started when I was the Crimson Sorcerer.
"We need your help to stop her."
I am stuck here, but I offer this<g id="female_leanpointConvince" /> - the Staff of Wizardry, my staff, became Corrupted and was buried deep in the mines south of here.
Even now, the Tempest seeks to reclaim it, and with it, all<g id="male_shakehead" /> my power. You cannot allow this.
"Even if we stop it, what about her?"

<g id="female_shrugDontcare" />There are too many possibilities. I'm sorry to tell you, most of them do not end well, but<g id="male_gestureForwardRighthand" /> listen to my sister. She's wiser than me anyhow.
The only thing I can tell<g id="female_youknow" /> you with confidence is to get that staff, and quickly.
"Then what do we do with it?"
The staff is a mighty artifact, beyond<g id="male_agree1" /> any other I ever madeâ€¦ and I made many.
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />You could cleanse it of Corruption, but that would take a source of immense power. I<g id="female_lookBehind" /> don't know. Iâ€¦ cannot remain here any longer.
"Why do you have to leave?"
I have<g id="male_crossarmsJudge" /> a temporal reprieve, one for which I sacrificed much. I may not get another.

<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />I must go. I sense Galahad wishes to follow.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> A foolish gesture, but I cannot stop him. Good<g id="male_bowDeepHandsAtSides" /> luck, Soulwarden. I hope we meet again somehow.
Though it is just the faintest thread<g id="male_lookRight" /> of hope, it is my only chance of finding Artorius on this infernal island.
I must thank you. Traveling<g id="female_youknowS" /> with you has renewed my dream, but from here, I must walk a different path.
"You're going in there?"
I am.<g id="male_nod1" /> Fare thee well, my friend.<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> I could not have wished for a finer companion.
I deeply regret I will not be at your side for the<g id="male_spreadhands" /> rest of your journey, but it is my first<g id="male_nodMild" /> and foremost duty to find my lord king.
"It's your decision, not mine."
So it is. I<g id="female_youknow" /> pray that we cross paths once again, Soulwarden.
<g id="female_explainS" />And when we do, I will rejoice in presenting you to my liege so he may honor and reward you for your service.<g id="male_saluteFistToChest" /> Until then, Godspeed!
That damned<g id="female_throwarmsFrustrated" /> fool knight! To lock himself in purgatory, and for what?<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> The chance to glimpse Artorius again? Bah!
My brother<g id="female_clenchfistsSuffer" /> is the tragic figure here! We hardly exchanged words before he was yanked back into oblivion!
"He accepted his fate."
He may have<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" /> accepted his fate, but that doesn't mean I have to! The fact he appeared at all proves there is some mechanism at work!
I<g id="female_impatient" /> will liberate you from this madness, brother! I will not sleep until I do!
"What about the Staff of Wizardry?"
Yes! Crisis upon crisis,<g id="female_wavehandPshaw" /> they stack up by the hour! But I will not abandon my brother so easily this time!
No,<g id="female_leanpointConvince" /> you'll have to ask Sun about these mines Myrddin referred to. Perhaps the elder druids knew of them.<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> I will remain here.
My<g id="female_theseidiots" /> mind is racing with a battering of ideas and a plague of emotions. There is a way, and I will not leave until I find it!
Where were you just now...? Did you find a way to elude me? If so, it was only temporary. Our bond cannot be broken.
Enter the portal
Approach the tower
Leave the Prison
Meet with Sun at {POITags}

It's about time!<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> You were gone so long, I came to search and then I saw that floating tower appear in the sky! This<g id="female_touchhands" /> has something to do with Myrddin, doesn't it?
"Myrddin left us a dire warning."
Heâ€¦<g id="female_worry" /> what? I'm sorry, I must've misunderstood. You met the Crimson Sorcerer?
I had always heard he was a force of destruction, but<g id="female_whattheheck" /> here you stand! What kind of warning did he pass to you?
"The Tempest seeks his staff."
<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />The Staff of Wizardryâ€¦ Myrddin's staff? I have<g id="female_shakeheadNo" /> only a passing knowledge of that history, but I have heard the stories of this staff.
After it became<g id="female_explainS" /> Corrupted, it is said the Crimson Sorcerer laid waste to entire villages.
If<g id="female_thinking" /> there is some danger of the Tempest acquiring that power, then the Motherwell will have to wait.
If the staff has not been reclaimed, does that<g id="female_tiltheadRemember" /> mean it's hidden somewhere? That we might find it first?
The Staff of Wizardry

At Myrddin's urging, the hunt begins for the headpiece of his Staff of Wizardry, a relic that could shift the balance of power in the fight against Corruption.\nTravel to the southern mines of Edengrove and locate the headpiece of the Staff.
"It's buried to the south."
That would<g id="male_nodUnderstand" /> be Annwn Deep...<g id="male_convince02" /> and that would explain the Corrupted massing that area!

<g id="female_gestureRightM" />If the Tempest already knows the staff's location,<g id="female_disappointed" /> then there's not a moment to spare. You must go to Annwn and do whatever it takes to find it first.
"What will you do?"
I would be a hindrance<g id="female_shrugNothingicando" /> in any battle, let alone one against the Corrupted.<g id="male_nodMild" /> I will find a safe place in view of the mine and await you.
The map indicates the Motherwell<g id="female_sighRelief" /> is near there, so I will search around and see what I can find.
Let me pack up here, I'll head out shortly. You have<g id="male_sighAcceptnews" /> more than enough to deal with than to wait around for me.
I realize now that I have given you far too many opportunities to join me. The time for an alliance has passed. It will be war, and you will lose.
I realize now that I have given you far too many opportunities to join me.
The time for an alliance has passed. It will be war, and you will lose.
Begin the search for Myrddin's Staff at {POITags}
Defeat the {targetName} and find evidence of the Staff
Continue the search for the Staff at {POITags}
Search within the mines for clues about the Staff
Examine the pick marks on the walls
The pick marks on the wall look a few weeks old.
Investigate the discarded tools
These tools were discarded some time ago.
Explore {POITags} for any further sign of the Staff
Search the depths of the mine
Defeat the incoming Corrupted before they can remove the Staff
Retrieve the headpiece of Myrddin's Staff
Find Sun and see what she has learned about the Motherwell

<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />As usual, I find you walking away from a ruckus<g id="male_leanforwardInspect" /> barely scathed. I thought my skills in healing might be of use, but I'm glad they're not.
You<g id="female_lookConcern" /> found the Corrupted Staff of Wizardry, did you? Yes, I sense it weighing on you.
The<g id="female_nodshrugokay" /> question now is what to do with this infernal artifact. It must be destroyed, but how?
Tell me it doesn't<g id="male_lookDown" /> need to be cast into the fires of the Shattered Mountain.
Speaker for the Green

With the headpiece of the Staff of Wizardry rescued from Isabella's forces, a way must be found to remove the taint of Corruption from the relic.\nFind the Speaker of the Green and gain permission to enter the Motherwell.
"We might be able to cleanse it."
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Cleanse it? But what could possibly<g id="female_notsure" /> have the capability to cleanse such a powerful artifact?
Oh, well of<g id="female_nodConsider" /> courseâ€¦ you're probably thinking what I'm thinking. The Motherwell.
"Did you find the location?"

Yes. I have discovered that the<g id="female_gestureUpward" /> summit of this mountain is sacred to the Angry Earth,<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> and I believe the entrance to the Motherwell is there.
But that is not all. The voice<g id="male_headNodYes" /> who speaks for the Angry Earth, she is there.
"Adiana? The Huntress?"
<g id="female_gesturebothhands" />Then you know of her? I had heard<g id="male_listenforward" /> rumors, but never encountered her until now. She has a strange aura, and a cold demeanor.
I sense<g id="male_crossarmsDoubt" /> however that she is the one who can give us permission to visit the Motherwell.
"I can speak to her."
Then I think that would be wise. We could attempt<g id="female_explainS" /> to get access to the Motherwell without her blessing, but it will be much better this way.
Let's<g id="female_gestureRight" /> go then. I'll show you to the place where the Huntress resides.
UNUSED - WALKAWAY
This<g id="female_spreadarms" /> is it. This is where I spoke with the Huntress, but I'm not sure you're ready yet.
I was skeptical of the claims of the elder druids, but<g id="female_lookaroundWonder" /> they knew of this place. The Silent Summit they called it. It is where the Forest Spirit resides.
Their promises<g id="female_lookRight" /> to the Angry Earth forbade them from coming here.
"You think Adiana was here, too?
Her voice is the same<g id="female_youknow" /> as that we heard at the Forest Shrines and the legends of the Huntress go far back.
So yes, I think it's quite<g id="female_taptemple" /> likely that she is the same one, and that makes me nervous.<g id="male_nodMild" /> Good luck.
Once again, I find<g id="female_handsonhipsShakehead" /> you trespassing on sacred ground, human. I wonder how many times I shall allow this.
I saw<g id="female_crossarmsSuspicious" /> you coming from afar, human, and I sensed the foul air of Corruption that accompanies you.

<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />I know you bear the headpiece of the Magus's staff<g id="female_liftHandsXs" /> and I want nothing to do with it.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> I thought you were smarter than this.
"We need to cleanse the staff."
Ohâ€¦ ?<g id="female_covermouthShocked" /> Is this why your polite friend visited previously and asked about the Motherwell?
You would seek my<g id="male_handsHipsDisapprove" /> blessing to tap into the Angry Earth's most sacred source of power to cleanse a Wizard's bauble?
"We must prevent her from using it."
That<g id="male_waghand03" /> is your problem, human, not ours. I told you before -<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> the Angry Earth has sacrificed enough against the Crimson Menace.
<g id="female_gestureRightM" />Allowing a corrupted Artifact into the Motherwell would infect it with Blight.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> I will never permit that.
"Then tell me what to do?"
See now, here<g id="male_tiltHeadRightBored" /> again, another tactic I've seen from humanity more times than I can count!
You impose on nature again and again, and<g id="female_throwarmsFrustrated" /> then when confronted, you plead ignorance.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> Begone, human. I have no more to say to you.
Do not<g id="female_theseidiots" /> try my patience. I have asked you to remove yourself from this sacred mountain, and I will not ask again.
Explore {POITags} for signs of the mysterious Speaker
Search for evidence of the Speaker's presence
The area was once well-traveled, as though others passed often.
Continue searching for the Speaker
This area seems to face the ruins above.
Travel up the cliff to {POITags}
Enter the ruins and meet the Speaker
I only heard snippets that carried on the wind,<g id="female_lookLeft" /> but it was enough to know our request was not granted.
My mind is<g id="female_lookConcern" /> churning with backup plans, something, anything the elder druids might have written about.
"The Tempest is coming. Make haste."
Then we may<g id="male_lookaroundWorried" /> be done for. We could perhaps shelter here, but the Huntress has forbidden us that reprieve as well.
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />I have to just say it, I sympathize<g id="male_clenchfistsAngry" /> with the Angry Earth, but that woman, she is cruel!
We come here asking for<g id="male_lookaroundSmall" /> help to battle a threat that would consume all Aeternum, and she can't be bothered!
It's tempting to defy<g id="female_pointThreaten" /> her entirely and take our chances in the Motherwell without her blessing.
The Motherwell
Against Adiana's warning, the decision has been made to purify the Staff of Wizardry in the Motherwellâ€¦ even knowing the consequences.\nEnter the Motherwell and purify the Headpiece of the Staff.
"That may be our only option."
Wait, are you seriously<g id="male_recoilAfraid" /> considering this? The Huntress warned that the staff would infect the Motherwell with Blight.

<g id="female_gestureLeftS" />I don't know how bad that may be, but would that be worth keeping the staff from the Tempest? Still,<g id="male_dontknow" /> I can't say what's right here. I trust your judgment.
"That's it, then. Let's do it."
Alright,<g id="male_headNodYes" /> at the risk of incurring her wrath,<g id="female_explainS" /> I will approach her and ask for her blessing again in order to provide a distraction.
The entrance<g id="female_gestureBehind" /> is over there. If we survive, we meet back at camp. Good luck...<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> to us both.
UNUSED - WALKAWAY
Who dares trespass in the Motherwell? You? Howâ€¦ dare you!
Stop this madness, at once!
We will not suffer on your behalf!
You have defied me, human, and I will not forget!
Oh, you win another victory? A cause for celebrationâ€¦ for you, but perhaps not for everyone.
A pity you cannot see through my eyes. I see banners of blue and gold, and fire. Glorious, beautiful fire.
Oh and now a pity you cannot hear through my ears, the cries of pain, the pleas for mercyâ€¦ the smashing of Heartgemsâ€¦
Oh and now a pity you cannot hear through my ears, the cries of pain, the pleas for mercyâ€¦
the smashing of Heartgemsâ€¦
I had forgotten how<g id="male_clutchhead02" /> exhausting it was dealing with my brother. I need to find an innâ€¦
Defy Adiana and enter the Motherwell
Place the Corrupted Headpiece within the Motherwell
Begin the ritual to purify the Corrupted Headpiece
(Optional) Defeat the Guardians
Protect the Staff from the Guardians
Claim the Purified Headpiece from the Motherwell
Travel through the Blighted Passage
Return to {POITags} to speak with Sun and Morgaine
Find Morgaine
Soulwarden?<g id="male_shocked" /> Are you here, or am I dreaming? I think I may have spent too much time at Myrddin's tower.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> Everything isâ€¦ murky.

string.comment: She says the first two sentences to Morgaine, the last sentence to the player
string.speaker: Sun Fuchun
string.name: AlchemistSun

resources.string: Worry not.<g id="male_explain" /> The Warden is indeed here.<g id="female_gestureRightM" /> Morgaine has been a bitâ€¦ beside herself since arriving.
Tell me,<g id="male_headtilthmm" /> were you able to get the Staff of Wizardry before the Tempest did?
"I did. The headpiece is cleansed."
<g id="female_smackfist" />Well, how perfect is that? Let me see here... I<g id="female_takeAndGiveItem8s" /> can take your Azoth staff, and imbue it like so... there you go!
Fascinating!<g id="male_spreadhands" /> And a positive result after what we had to do to accomplish this,<g id="female_gesturebothhands" /> regardless of how the Huntress might respond.
Now,<g id="female_headshakesmall" /> what were we talking about?<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> Were we talking about dreams?
We did it. I<g id="female_swayBored" /> can't believe we did it, but we did. The Huntress will be furious in ways I fear will come back to haunt us.
A Shadow Falls
Morgaine's dream and Isabella's whispering tells of an attack on the Soulwarden fortress of Caer Dun.\nHurry to Caer Dun and investigate.
I-I<g id="male_handshipsdisapprove" /> must've dozed off up there, by that swirling maelstrom of chaos that swallowed my brother.
I<g id="male_lookUpAround" /> had a dream in which I was in Caer Dun, only it was burningâ€¦<g id="female_gestureLeftS" /> it was more of a nightmare, really.
"I fear your dream may be reality."
Really?<g id="male_shocked" /> Then what are you waiting for? You should go, before it is too late!
We<g id="male_concernS" /> all should go if the situation is as dire as you say!<g id="male_convince02" /> Hurry, Warden! I will ensure that Morgaine is all right, then meet you there.
I<g id="male_dismissGetLost1" priority="high" /> cannot see straight, let alone go into battle, but I will try and find you when I can.<g id="female_explainS" /> Make haste to Caer Dun, Soulwarden!
Hurry, Warden! I will ensure<g id="female_lookRight" priority="high" /> that Morgaine is all right, then meet you there.
I<g id="male_wavehandDismissive" /> will be fine. You should go to Caer Dunâ€¦ as quickly as possible!
We need to get<g id="male_gestureHereweare" /> these fires out, then find Yonas! Help me, please!
Whereâ€¦ where were you? The<g id="male_guiltyLookside" /> attack, it came on so quickly. The whole place was burning, and Corrupted everywhere!
They tore out<g id="male_hanghead" /> our Heartgems and smashed themâ€¦ and thenâ€¦ Yonas.
"Yes, I need to find Yonas."
<g id="male_headShakeNo" />Sheâ€¦ I mean that thing, that<g id="male_ragepunchfistsdown" /> demon dragged him off towards the north gate. Let's go quicklyâ€¦ perhaps there is still time.

He-he saved<g id="female_lookdownSorry" /> me you see, and then he was knocked down, but there wasn't anything I could doâ€¦ They have taken our fearless leader captive,<g id="female_shrugDontcare" /> and with him, my hope.
"Which way did they go?"
I think they went<g id="female_headshakeSmall" /> westâ€¦ I think, but I do not know.
After I saw the darkness in her eyes, everything<g id="male_pleadHandsopen" /> is very foggy in my memoryâ€¦ go after him, after Yonas, if you can. Please!
What do<g id="female_worry" /> we do nowâ€¦? What ifâ€¦ what if she comes back?
We are too<g id="female_youknowS" /> late returning homeâ€¦ I see Yash.<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> Is there anyone else? Anyone?
We must leave. There is nothing for us here. I suppose<g id="female_touchhands" /> I should return to Ebonscale Reach. You are welcome to come with me, Soulwarden.
I have heard the news from Caer Dun, Soulwarden. I am sorry, so very sorry. We've all lostâ€¦ lost too much, I think.
xxxxxx
Look who's here! Ah, but you've just missed all the excitement. Extracting a Heartgem is easier than I imagined!
You thought you were getting the edge, but you never had a chance. What little you accomplished, I have taken.
Here is your mentor, your friendâ€¦ or what's left of him. Ha!
I don'tâ€¦ wantâ€¦ this! Stop me!
The heartgem! Destroy it!
Do itâ€¦ please! End this!
You haveâ€¦ savedâ€¦ me. Thank youâ€¦
One by one, your allies fall. I wonder, how did it feel, striking down the old man? Perhaps now, you'll begin to listen.
One by one, your allies fall. I wonder, how did it feel, striking down the old man?
Perhaps now, you'll begin to listen.
Hurry to {POITags}
Search {POITags} for survivors
Douse the fires raging within {POITags}
Follow Yash to the gates
Inspect the broken fishing pole
Follow Isabella's path to the west
Enter the Corrupted Cave
Use the Azoth Staff to lay Yonas to rest
Eliminate the Corrupted blocking the path
Confront Isabella
Defeat {targetName}
Leave the Corrupted Cave
Return to {POITags} and tell Yash of Yonas's fate
There you are! I've been watching<g id="male_pleadHandsclasped" /> so long my eyes are hurting. But where is Yonas? Did you find him? I-I don't understand.
"Yonas is gone, Yash. I'm sorry."
Noâ€¦ not Yonas. I-I don't understandâ€¦ these heartgems<g id="male_shocked" /> were supposed to protect us from Corruption!<g id="male_headShakeNo" /> How did this happen? Was it all a lie?
I am sorry, I know I should pull myself together. Perhaps I just need time. So many Wardens lost.
I wonder how those fare who remain in the north, at the outposts we established.
To Shattered Mountain
With the fortress of Caer Dun in shambles, plans against the forces of Corruption have stalled.\nTravel to Shattered Mountain and give the terrible news to Warden Yseult.
"In Great Cleave?"
Yes, and even further, behind the lines in Shattered Mountain, but they were barely holding their positions. Yonas planned to send reinforcements.
But now, there is no one to send.
"I can go."
Then you should. There is nothing left here, very little to even salvage. If our cause has any chance at all, it is in assaulting the Shattered Mountain.
Go. Whatever shred of hope remains in my heart goes with you.
We will do what we can here, then we will come north. There is nowhere else to go.
Hail, Warden! Are you the vanguard of our reinforcements?
I'd expected to see Yonas crossing the mountains at the front of a great force, but you are the only one we've seen. How long until the army arrives?
"Yonas has fallen. No one's coming."
Hearing that Yonas has fallenâ€¦ that is a blow. His loss will be felt for quite some time.
And without reinforcements on the way, we may be forced to abandon this position.
Behold, Edengrove, the jewel of Aeternum!
Here is a land where nature still commands. Itâ€™s thorny, poisonous, and beautiful,
and youâ€™ll never find in all the world such an abundance of peculiar flora.
Speaking of peculiar, did you know the life cycle of the Angry Earth begins in Edengrove?
Iâ€™ve been studying them for ages, but always from a distance.
It seems now we must study them ever more closely.
There is an enclave founded by the elder druids to the north; we will have to visit thereâ€¦
they undoubtedly hoard some of the knowledge we seek...
